availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William B. Hoke (Louisville, Kentucky, attorney and notary public)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, attorney and notary public. Kentucky native. Married to Whorten L. Hoke. Father of Nannie Hoke. Attorney in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1860. Notary public in Jefferson County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 3, p. 131.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 6, p. 66.

KYR-0001-004-1377.
